p: Cheng and coworkers reported the interesting antiarthritic effects of cinnamaldehyde [ 57]. At concentrations of 60 and 80 nM, it was able to significantly suppress IL-1Î²-induced cytokine production in MH7A cells via the suppression of JAK/STAT pathways. Moreover, cinnamaldehyde was demonstrated to have beneficial effects on collagen-induced arthritis in rats.
